interactions: MAJOR: Warfarin + Fluconazole - Fluconazole inhibits warfarin metabolism, significantly increasing bleeding risk
MAJOR: Warfarin + Aspirin - Combined anticoagulant and antiplatelet effects increase bleeding risk
MODERATE: Aspirin + Ibuprofen - NSAIDs may reduce cardioprotective effects of low-dose aspirin
MODERATE: Warfarin + Ibuprofen - NSAIDs increase bleeding risk and may affect warfarin metabolism
recommendations: Monitor INR closely if fluconazole is initiated with warfarin - consider dose reduction
Use gastroprotective agent given dual antiplatelet/anticoagulant therapy
Consider acetaminophen instead of ibuprofen for pain management
Schedule regular bleeding risk assessments and patient counseling
